weeklyTopNews.title: Victoria's 14-day average continues to fall with 43 coronavirus new cases, nine deaths reported
weeklyTopNews.summary: Victoria reported 43 new covid-19 cases and 9 deaths. Victoria's two-week average continues to go down with regional Victoria now having just 72 active cases and a two-week average of just 4.5 new cases.

weeklyTopNews.title: The Oxford coronavirus vaccine trial has been paused. Experts say we shouldn't be worried
weeklyTopNews.summary: Testing of the Oxford coronavirus vaccine has been halted after one of the participants experience an 'averse reaction'. Experts have expressed that the pause is a routine measure to allow for a thorough investigation a 'potentially unexplained illness' being experienced by the participant in question.

weeklyTopNews.title: Older Australians volunteering for next step in COVID-19 vaccine trials
weeklyTopNews.summary: The trial is being conducted by clinical research company Linear at the Queen Elizabeth II Medical Centre in Perth. The vaccine is manufactured by Clover Biopharmaceuticals.

weeklyTopNews.title: Victoria's roadmap for easing coronavirus lockdown restrictions: what you need to know
weeklyTopNews.summary: Melbourne's stage 4 restrictions have been extended for 2 weeks, and the state government has released a 'roadmap' for Victoria's easing of coronavirus restrictions.
